Description: A terracotta head broken from a flask in the form of a Nubian, surmounted by a carinated neck and mouth, and with two pierced handles. Two-piece mould. Brown clay with no apparent mica: perhaps not a Nile silt, but no doubt of Egyptian manufacture; overall orange-brown slip.
Curator's comments: Terracotta IV Purchased: Greville J. Chester. Ptolemaic, second or first century BC. Comparanda: See registration no. GR 1990,0601.1 (from the same mould-series). Near, but coarser (head and handled mouth only): George 1974: 36, figs 9 and 10.
Bibliographic references: Terracotta / Catalogue of Terracottas in the British Museum (3660)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev Greville John Chester
